meta.subject: PHYSICS 5124
meta.philosophy: The syllabus aims to provide a valuable educational experience in experimental and practical science, enabling pupils to become confident citizens in a technological world, make informed scientific decisions, appreciate the scientific method in everyday life, and prepare for further science studies. It develops abilities in scientific practice, efficient and safe work, effective communication, and fosters attitudes like accuracy, objectivity, integrity, inquiry, initiative, inventiveness, and critical thinking. It also promotes awareness of science's social, economic, technological, ethical, and environmental influences and impacts.
meta.competence_learning: The syllabus is reviewed in line with Outcome Based Education principles, linking education to real-life experiences to develop skills in accessing, criticizing, analyzing, and practically applying knowledge. It aims for learners to achieve competences and general outcomes through knowledge, skills, techniques, and values essential for individual and national development. Effective implementation requires clarity of focus, reflective design, high expectations for all learners, and appropriate opportunities.
goals: Demonstrate an understanding of thermal physics
Demonstrate an understanding of wave motion
key_competences: Demonstrate ability to show how pressure varies with volume and temperature
Show skills and knowledge on the construction of thermometers
Demonstrate ability to show heat transfer in solids, liquids, and gases
